name: sandra naylor
text: This was a cross country move. My initial delivery date was scheduled so I hired movers to unload the POD based on the delivery date I was guaranteed. 3 days prior to my initial delivery date I was informed that my POD would be delivered in 10 days. No apology, no reason whatsoever. Posted on PODS site, my container was sitting in their Chandler AZ warehouse and I lived 16 miles away. I've used them in the past, never again.

resp.text: We certainly don’t like to see this, Sandra. If you’d like to chat, please email socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID and additional details.

name: Mindy Moore
text: Great customer service!!!  Gave a discount on first month POD rental because the delivery fee was a little higher than estimated. Delivered on time and placed in exact discussed location.

resp.text: We're delighted to see this, Mindy! Thanks for stopping by and sharing your experience! And great picture of your PODS container!

name: Kevin G
text: Pods is awesome. I'm a driver for this company so I know first hand how amazing this company is.

resp.text: Thanks for your five-star review, Kevin!

name: Sherry Reese
text: Was on time, except for once and that was because of traffic. Parked it perfectly each time and made it very accessible.  All the guys were very polite and friendly.  Thank you.

resp.text: Kudos to our stellar team! And thank you, Sherry, for acknowledging their commitment to delivering exceptional customer care! We're looking forward to working with you again soon!

name: Katherine Gonzalez
text: Such good quality for a great price. Everyone was so helpful and kind.- from customer support to the drivers to the moving company that PODS recommended. Will only be using PODS for all of my moving needs from here on out.

resp.text: Hi, Katherine! Thank YOU for choosing PODS and sharing this wonderful review with us. We count ourselves lucky for customers like you!

name: jruff76203
text: I placed my things in storage in a pod in June 2020 to move home so I could have help during Covid with my newborn. I moved in my new place March 2021 only to find a rusted pod on the exterior and all of my possessions  ruined from a rat infestation. I contacted Pods immediately and still have yet to hear from them. I have no clothes, dishes, shoes or furniture except from what I had with me. I was devastated and have to start over with nothing. I even had content protection and still haven’t heard anything pods. It’s devastating thinking I paid 250 a month not including the transport cost for nothing. I thought I was taking the safest route but I was wrong.  Save yourself the trouble and choose a storage unit you can walk into that’s secure and not rat infested. I’m devastated and out of thousands as I have an infant and cannot salvage rat infested furniture.

resp.text: Hello, we're disappointed to read you've had this type of experience. We want to be able to have this looked into further. Please email socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID so we may best assist.

name: Gary Johnson
text: Everything about the Pod rental was great except for the driver running over and damaging my front yard. When contacted I expressed my displeasure with the yard and was told by the area manager that he would repair my yard the next day or the day after and was sorry but it’s been a week or so and I still haven’t had my yard repaired nor have I been contacted to give me an update or to tell me it was gonna be later when they will come because something came up. I just want communication from their part on the situation. The actual rental, storage and moving of the pod was great but the yard being damaged just overshadowed the good. Very disappointing. If Pods storage rectifies the situation I’ll use them in the future but if they don’t, I’ll never use them again.

resp.text: We appreciate you bringing this to our attention and would like to research this further, Gary. Can you please email socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID?

name: Robert Norton III
text: Funny thing. I have never used PODS. One of your customers either fat-fingered my phone number in or they did it intentionally. I call customer service to find out why I was getting phone calls from the company and to have my number removed. The woman that I spoke to was EXTREMELY helpful and apologetic for the inconvenience.

resp.text: Happy to hear we were able to get this resolved, Robert! We appreciate your kind words!

name: Jay Roberts
text: I would never use them again, charged me storage for a month I didn't use, never contacted me to let me know my container was here, never heard back from a senior team lead when I was told that one would contact me. To my military family that maybe on the fence about using PODS look elsewhere.

resp.text: This certainly isn't how we want you to feel, Jay. We've shared your concerns with our customer resolution team and requested that they review and follow up with you.

name: Nannette Smith
text: Did not deliver on time or pick up and overcharged us  Door was jammed and things fell out

resp.text: Hi, Nannette! We’re disappointed to see this. We encourage you to send us an email at socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID and additional details so we may best assist.

name: Gary Franklin
text: PODS staff were very helpful in making my long-distant move such a breeze.   I'd definitely will be using their service again as well as recommending my friends to use PODS.

resp.text: Moving is not easy, so we’re glad we were able to help ease some of the stress along the way! Thank you, Gary!

name: Marsha Bradford
text:
You are never able to keep your pod for the full 30 days that you have paid for.
I understand scheduling conflicts, however a refund for the days less than 30 should be refunded.

The first few reps I spoke with were absolutely wonderful!  They latest one...not so much. I had a difficult time understanding him. His English was poor at best.
I will recommend PODS.

resp.text: A big thank you for sharing your thoughts, Marsha. We rely on customers such as yourself to let us know how we can better meet their expectations. Your feedback will be shared with all of the appropriate groups.

name: Kristin Garrigan
text: I recently used PODS to move and they made the experience a lot less stressful with convenient delivery and pick up times, contactless service and very affordable pricing! I will definitely be recommending them to everyone!

resp.text: We'd be super appreciative of you spreading the word to your friends and family about our moving/storage services, Kristin! Thank you so very much for choosing PODS! It was a pleasure working with you!

name: Lee Witherington
text: Great concept. Had an issue with delivery dates but no harm done.

resp.text: We just love working with customers like you, Lee! Thank you so much for the feedback and super review.

name: Lance Huffstutler
text: I like that they pick up and drop off the pods. Customer service has always been good. They have left locks out of my order and set up the wrong delivery address

resp.text: Hi, Lance! Thanks so much for your review and feedback! If we haven't had a chance to connect about the locks you ordered but didn't receive, please email socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID.

name: Tom McDougal
text: AVOID! This was a HORRIBLE experience. I booked them and they said it was easy to change drop off and pick up reservations. WRONG! When I rescheduled they screwed up the pick up part of the reservation and the PODS are still sitting in the driveway and they are now 5 days late picking up. 6 phone calls and you never can reach anyone local bc they won’t return a phone call. The national call center is rude and no help - other than taking a reservation they have no impact on local operations. The worst part is THEY JUST DON’T CARE! I would give them a -5 Star review if it was possible. Run! Don’t do business with this company unless you want a hassle and to be treated with disrespect and experience the WORST customer service possible.

resp.text: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback, Tom. We certainly don’t like to see this. If you’d like to chat, please email socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID and additional details.

name: Lawrence Maske
text: Customer service is excellent.  Problems handled professionally,  quickly and completely.

resp.text: Thanks for putting a smile on our face, Lawrence! Glad we could help!

name: brittany west
text: I was trying to move so I rented a pod I called in my address, but it was put in wrong, so I changed it to the correct address because gods  only knows where it would have ended up. I noticed that my order was cancelled they day before it was scheduled to get picked up  just because i change the address to the correct one. When I called to ask why they cancelled my order they just blamed it on me! I even put the date back in when i changed the address. My stuff sat at the my old house that I sold for over 3 DAYS. I'm sure the new owner was upset over it it was more than likely in his way of moving in. I took vacation days to move which was a waste of my  time, I had to live without a lot of my stuff for that time, even my brothers asked for the days off to help unload it. It was five days before I was off again and had the help to unload my stuff. I  have recommend to other people to just rent a u haul!

resp.text: We appreciate you bringing this to our attention, Brittany, and we take your concerns very seriously. We'd like to learn more, please reach out to socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID so we can take a look.

name: GRACE LOVE
text: The driver refused to wait 10 minutes for me to get onsite to move a truck over 10feet. Then I was charged $54.50 re-pickup fee. No one told me about the fee until I got my final bill and called to inquire and was told that the local site made the decision to charge me the fee and they would have to issue a refund. WILL NEVER USE THEIR SERVICES AGAIN!!

resp.text: This is disappointing to see, Grace. We always aim for a seamless experience and we would like to learn more. Please reach out to us at socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID so we can look into this further.

name: Stephen Yeatman
text:
Worst experience to date. Driver called to say he would be on-site in 45 minutes at 6AM. He then called back 20min later saying he was leaving the house.
Claimed too many vehicles in driveway. There were 2 cars in a circular drive that can park 9 cars easy. He had an entire entrance to back in and drop the POD. He refused to let the people on-site move their cars out of the way and left. I have asked 3 different customer service reps to let me speak to manager of local branch. They refuse to give out info. Claim to have left a request for them to contact me. Still have not received any calls. Now having to wait until the end of the week for them to re deliver. Do not use.

resp.text: Let's connect, Stephen. Can you please send us your customer ID to socialmedia@pods.com so we can help?

name: Louise W
text:
This is absolutely the worst company I’ve ever dealt with. Not only did the pod get delivered late the day that it was supposed to show, On the day that the pod was supposed to be picked up they just didn’t show.  I had a confirmation email and when I called three hours after the window I was told that the date is not a guarantee?!? The POD was supposed to be gone before I closed, selling my house and they missed the date!!!! Then, they had the nerve to say they were doing me a special service to pick up the POD the following day.

Also, The POD is quite small.  I got the large one and it definitely did not fit a 2 bedroom home.

name: Jason Shafer
text: Excellent

resp.text: We're delighted to see this, Jason! Thanks for choosing PODS!

name: Richard Ferris
text: Well if I could give PODs a zero I would.  The delivery went fine, however when I called for the pickup I was told they only pickup in my area on certain days.  This was never mentioned when I ordered the POD.  The dates they could pick up and move to the new location were not available for me.  Therefore I had to empty the POD and move the contents to the new location.  They will be picking the container up at the same location they brought it to.  Total waste of  $400.

resp.text: We certainly don’t like to see this, Richard. If you’d like to chat, please send us an email to socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID.

name: Martha Storm
text: Very professional , dependable and on time .

resp.text: We appreciate your kind words, Martha! Take care!

name: Rachel Key
text:
Terrible! Charged my card even after the reservation was canceled.
Reservations must be canceled by 4pm the day before the POD arrives. Which I did, but my card was still charged and I've been told that I have to wait 5 to 7 business days to get my refund. Definitely lesson learned and the BBB has been contacted. Terrible way to do business.

resp.text: We'd be happy to look into this, Rachel. We encourage you to send us an email at socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID and additional details so we may best assist.

name: Mark Midyette
text: These guys were just great!  They were on time, took great care not to mess my lawn up and we were very pleased.  Although I REALLY don't ever want to have to move the stuff out of my house again, I'll call them in a flash I that happens.

name: Kewanee Fox
text: PODS is the best idea I have ever seen. I appreciated that we could pack and move at our pace. I had to pull items from the POD at least twice. I went online to set the time when I would be there and it went smooth. When it was time to move to our location we unpacked with ease as well. I cannot say anything bad about our experience. I will use PODS again should the need arise. I have already recommednded to family and friends.

name: Haley Capps
text: Pods made our move so much easier! They delivered/picked up the container exactly when they said they would. Our pod was in storage for 2 months, and all of our things came back exactly how we left them! No weird smell either! I will definitely use them again the next time we move.

resp.text: This is what we like to hear, Haley! We're glad we could assist! We certainly have your back when you need us again!

name: Michael Matthews
text:
The service that we received from PODS was great!  The drivers were very mindful of placement of the PODS and took great care when picking up the PODS.

As for their billing, it needs A LOT of help!  It is very confusing and once I thought we were paid in full, I received another bill about 6 months later.  The billing process is the only thing that would cause me to hesitate to use PODS in the future.  Other than that, I would recommend them.

resp.text: John, we are very glad to hear about your satisfaction with our drivers. However, we apologize for the troubles that you experienced with our billing. Please send an e-mail to podsrequest@pods.com if there is anything that we can do to help or any questions that we can answer for you.

name: Angie Beaubien
text: DO NOT use this company!!!! Terrible customer service! Made an appointment 2 weeks ago for a delivery with a pod pick up the next day. NO SHOW!!! Second time this has happened!

resp.text: Hello, Angie. We're disappointed to see this. We'd like the chance to connect and look into this further. Please send us your customer ID and additional details to socialmedia@pods.com so we can get started.

name: Justin Roberts
text: For the overall experience it was good. The only thing I will say about the Birmingham, AL location is that the building is not climate controlled. It is ventilated only. I had a cloth chair that had obvious mold due to not being a climate and humidity control environment.

name: Spencer Hedges
text:
I was trying to move household items i had inherited from Canada to my home in the USA. The pod was delivered on time during its specified delivery window.

The problem came with the lack of local support and the poor customer service with respect to the documentation required by the movers. Despite frequent efforts on my part to clarify which documents were required i came to the conclusion that dealing with this company long distance was not going to work for me. One of the documents for example was for the driver! Why was i receiving this and exactly what should i have filled in? I was simply told they all had to be filled in.

In order to avoid further aggravation i decided to switch to more traditional movers at a substantial price increase but peace of mind since they absolutely knew what import documents were required. To top it all off PODS charged me $400 for drop off and pick up of the pod i hadnt used due to their incompetence.

resp.text: Hi Spencer, we'd like to connect with you further regarding your experience. Do you mind sending us an email to socialmedia@pods.com with your customer ID so we can chat further?

name: Alex Dendy
text: The young man that picked up our POD was FANTASTIC! His name is Brandon and is superb.

resp.text: We'll be sure to pass along your praise, Alex! Thanks for choosing PODS for your moving/storage needs!

name: Steve Loyd
text: Prompt, efficient, and polite. These guys were great. They made a challenging experience easier and less stressful!

name: Brandon Jones
text: I highly discourage anyone from using this incompetent company.  Worst customer service!  My story goes like this.  Ordered 2 PODS and realized the day of loading that I was going to need another one.  I called PODS and requested a new container and the call lasted for two hours and fifteen minutes.  I also scheduled the pickup for all the PODS after loaded and was assured all three would be stored in Montgomery, AL, which would be the closest storage facility that would deliver to my new address in Auburn, AL.  The technician told me to just call about three days before I needed them delivered to the new address and there wouldn’t be any issue.  There was a big issue.  They didn’t store my PODS in Montgomery, they stored them in Birmingham and claimed they needed five days for transit and three day for logistics.  I spoke to three or four supervisors and nobody could do anything to get my PODS on the day I requested.  They did say that if my PODS would have been stored in Montgomery like they said there would not have been any issue.  THEIR FAULT! So they put in an account review and some guy called and stated they lost the 2:15 min call I had with them.  He credited my account $100 dollars and said basically take it or leave it and he didn’t have to give me anything.  So I accepted I was getting my PODS on the earliest date they said.  I moved my entire family down the day prior because all three PODS were scheduled to be delivered.  They only delivered two of the three and stated the other one was never scheduled.  I asked if someone could just please contact the Birmingham facility and see if they can make an exception and deliver it the next day but was met with the standard “that is not our policy or procedure”.  I had to drive my family back to my parent’s house to stay with them for another week because the one POD they didn’t send is the one with all of our furniture.  It is taking them nine additional days to deliver my last POD and I’m having to take more vacation time off to unload it.  They also charged me for and extra month of storage because due to their mistake the PODS were in storage for more than 30 days and they don’t prorate monthly storage fees.  I will never use this company again.  They have ONE job, to deliver/store PODS and they can’t even do that right.  WHEN they make a mistake, and they will, they will not fix it.  They will tell you to submit and account review and someone will get back to you in 3-5 days.  Not one time did I call them and spend less than an hour on the phone.  If you ask for a supervisor, they put you on hold for half hour and then come back on stating they are busy.

Horrible service. Find a company that actually cares.

name: Nick Beadle
text: Wasn't pleased about the month notice they gave me about increasing the rent fee.  Basically suggesting pay the increase or leave.  Management sucks.... In-store and District.  Called customer care line and was told either one will call me... never happened.

resp.text: Hi Nick Beadle , the staff at iStorage Laceys Spring take our reviews very seriously and we appreciate you taking the time to share your concerns with us. It is thanks to feedback like yours that we can tackle issues that may impact our most valuable asset; our customers. I have sent your comments to the management at iStorage Laceys Spring for review and you should have received a call from the District Manager to discuss your concerns. We value all our customers and work hard to keep our prices competitive and fair. Unfortunately, operating cost such as property taxes, insurance, maintenance, utilities, overhead, etc. are not stable and increase year over year.  For us to maintain excellent service levels we must pass along a portion of those increases to our customers.  In addition, unlike several of our competitors who raise rents every couple of months, we process increases annually.  We are continuing to make improvements throughout the facility including asphalt, paint and building repairs to ensure that your experience at iStorage is the best possible. We look forward to serving you in the future. If there is anything more we can do to improve your experience please email us at info@istorage.com or give us a call toll free at 844-311-2342. Best Regards, the iStorage Team.

text: Overall we had a good experience reserving and moving in.  The facility is clean, well lit, and seems safe enough that I wouldn't mind going by myself or in the evenings. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was that I had a few issues with the call-line.  They were having computer issues and it took quite a while to reserve the unit. We got disconnected multiple times and had to repeat information over and over because the computer kept shutting down.  They were very apologetic and always called back promptly. I'm sure this was an isolated issue and I thought they handled it well considering it was frustrating for them as well. I would definitely recommend them to friends.

name: Warren D. Sweeney
text:
I am a Piano Tuner/Technician who at times have to store pianos in my 6x12 enclosed trailer. I had 2 grand pianos (stored on their side) and a self-player upright strapped in place when my sister asked to borrow the trailer to move her son's furniture and belongings from an apartment to a home he had purchased.
My storage areas were maxxed so I had to find a quick fix for my situation. I had just checked with Morningstar Storage about temporary storage prices for a customer the day before, so I called them once again. Within an hour I was moving the pianos into a storage unit that was not only spacious enough (with room to spare), but fit within my budget and was a safe environment for the instruments.
The representatives there were very professional and so helpful in solving my delimma. I am so thankful to have your company in our area.

Warren D. Sweeney
Alabaster, Alabama

name: Shane D
text: New manager is inexperienced. Doesn't even know how to take a payment.  Calls me sweetie.  Every other word out of her mouth is sweet heart or sweetie.  Its really fake!  She couldn't even take my payment.   I ship and pay for federal express several times a month here and now I have learned I have to go somewhere else for fedex.  Closest location is in hoover and quite a drive.  One of the reasons I chose Cool Box Private storage is because of their federal express shipping services. New manager couldn't even tell me what size storage unit I would need because she doesn't understand the concept of the storage industry. Also couldn't tell me what all would fit on the truck.  If you get a unit you only get their free box truck for 4 hours and then you have to pay per hour over that.  Lots of hidden fees here as well.  There is a fee for application, they make you buy their insurance and make it pain in the butt to prove you have your own, they make you buy their lock as well. By the time all is said and done you are paying about 50 bucks more than the price for the unit.  This is a greedy company.  I plan on moving out at the end of the month.  Still very clean and secure here, but the price is simply not worth it.  No fedex service is a major inconvenience.

name: David Dorris
text:
This was the worst "secure" storage facility I have ever used. The doors were propped open regularly, they
had people living in the units that were not locked and they knew it because it had been reported. Now they are rebuilding the secure units but have made no attempt to settle any disputes with the renters when the units burned to the ground. The video cameras were not working  and homeless people were living in the open  units at night when no one was around.
This place sucks.
signed - Lost everything in three large units.
They have made no effort to settle.

name: Devin Cothern
text: I had a storage unit for a few months then this unit burned completely down.  Two units down from mine, a guy & lady were living in it. I reported this numerous times with no action. After this unit burned down, they said they didn't receive my paperwork i had completed prior, for my extra insurance. They offered myself & everyone else $2,000. This is a joke. This company is negligent & they proved it. My aunt had a red dot storage on schillinger rd that got broken into as well & they didn't offer anything. They told her "they didn't have cameras" . If you care about your belongings, I would NOT DARE  put your stuff in any of these facilities.

name: Jen Martin
text: My storage unit was broken into and red dot wouldn't do anything about it!!! F tryWouldn't even look into it unless I filed a police report and for personal reasons I was unable to do that..... I lost all my valuables, lawn equipment and personal stuff and I actually pay extra each month for insurance smdh makes me sick

name: rueal golemon
text: Was super easy to get a storage bay! The pricing was a great surprise to what I was paying!!! Phone support was at the top shelf level! Account setup was quick and smooth! Even as a self service storage everything was clean and looked to be well maintained. Talked with 3 CS all were very helpful. Believe CS agent Robert set everything up for me.Very knowledgeable professional to have on your team.

name: Amber Sinclair
text: not a fan

resp.text: We apologize for any issues you've experienced and would love to offer a resolution. In order to provide you the best customer experience however, we need more information. Please contact us at (855) 733-3681 so that we can ensure you're receiving the best possible care. Thank you!

name: Peggy Adams (Pooh)
text: I would rent from them again.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your review Peggy and we appreciate your business!

name: osareafallire
text:
UPDATE: I set a calendar reminder 3 days and 1 day prior to my bill being due. On both days I checked my account balance. It was $0.00.
Six days later I received a text message advising me to pay my bill to avoid late fees. I logon the SAME day to make my payment and see that I've ALREADY been charged a late fee. In other words, they give you five days out of 30 during which to pay your bill without avoiding a late fee.

Oh, also, apparently there's a door in the back that always remains open and unlocked next to a fence that's about 3 feet high so all of their security systems either don't work when they should or do work when the shouldn't.
- the exit gate that has worked 2 weeks out of 4 months I've been there
- I've been given 4 gate codes which have been turned off without warning or notification
- There's no CERTAIN number of days during which the property manager is required to remove the lockout on your storage unit if you don't pay your bill within those 5 days. It certainly ISN'T the SAME or NEXT day which would be the case if there were an attendant. But then if there were an attendant that back door probably wouldn't remain open and unlocked.

The first night I got there I will admit the customer service agent was pretty helpful getting me into the unit since neither the gate code I was given or the building code worked for me. They were able to get me inside after a couple calls and they were nice enough so kudos for that.

I think this is the only company I've ever had to deal with that doesn't send you a bill before they send you a late charge. Red Dot conveniently reminds you of your monthly payment...the same day they charge you the late fee. I've never received an invoice or payment reminder prior to the late notice which I receive via text message and email.

I've also received text messages telling me when the gate will be closed for holidays and stuff. The message I'm getting is they want you to know when you can't get to your stuff and they want you to know once they've charged you a late fee but don't want to notify you when your bill should be paid on time. No worries, I've set a reminder of my own so sorry, you'll have to do without the extra $10 you've been accustomed to receiving.

The exit gate has been broken for almost 2 months. For a while it would still open automatically when you drove up to it but it could still be pulled or pushed open from either side. Now there's just a big chain around it. They could probably have had it repaired for the amount they've charged me in late fees but they're probably too busy slapping red pad locks on units they've yet to send out a late notice on.

name: Rebecca Eskridge
text: The facility is clean, easy to access, and the customer service via phone was wonderful! They offer a 5$ discount for auto pay which I was happy to sign up for!

name: Betty Longoria
text: This place was a joke the day we were moving our things into climate control the lock was broken!! we COULDNT even get in then they said we could put into a non climate control but we had valuable items that couldn't not be in a non climate control. They COULDNT even give us a date or time frame as to when it would be fixed. Then I just got a bill!!?? hello I NEVER left my belongings and you're going to send me a bill?? idiots!!!

text: So far so good! Happy with their security so far!

name: Joshua Kress
text: Not happy with this place. I come to pick up a trailer, get here after midnight friday and gate wont open. I used the right code and still couldnt get in. Come to find out, lightning struck the place and messed the system up and wont work. IT works on it and gets it up and running the next day. I come this sunday morning to pick up the trailer and go but yet again gate wont open. Tried calling but no answer. How is it that a place like this doesnt have a 24/7 call center for stuff like this and get to working on getting this fixed when they get warnings about this kind of stuff? Very disappointing.

name: Michael Alexander Urbanek
text:
Morningstar Storage Eastwood is the best storage facility I have ever used...
and, I have used a few over the years!
We had to store some of our furniture  when we moved from our home to an apartment!  Then, because my wife was very sick with end stage liver disease and doing chemotherapy with her having cancer of the blood and the start of Covid-19, my wife and I lost 70% of our income! With that, we only had my SSD check! On September 9th, 2020 we were evicted from our apartment exactly one week after celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary! Then, 3 weeks later on October 1, 2020 my wife passed away!!!
I want to say "Thank You" to the current Manager Craig Harrison and the previous Manager Bo Reynolds!
Both of these gentlemen have always been helpful in what ways they could, even if it was just listening to me ramble on!!! Thank You!!!

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to review our property, Michael. From all of us at Morningstar, our deepest condolences for your loss. We're glad we've been able to be here for you during difficult times and that we've been able to relieve some stress - please don't hesitate to let us know anything else we can do to help.

text:
I do not recommend Morningstar storage unless you're prepared to pay triple the amount of your rental each month. In other words you can get ready because there are so many hidden fees aside from the rent by the time my $285 per month 10 by 12 foot space was due the amount was closer to $400.  And they will quickly put a lien on your property and sell your belongings quickly which seems to be a hidden agenda.  Don't expect help from the anonymous district manager because she will not respond to any issue you may have.  I'm still waiting on my prorated rent check from December 12 and was told it mailed Dec 23rd
Not sure were it was mailed from but I'm pretty sure by Jan 2 it's had plenty of time to arrive. Not really counting on it anytime soon.
Terrible experience as well as costly.

text: I rented at CoolBox for 4 months and they are the best place my family and I have ever stayed! The staff is so nice and are more than willing to help! I highly recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to rent a storage unit whether for long or short term. My favorite things had to be the easy access to many entrances, gated, and the large elevators that easily fit bed frames and other large furniture.

name: David Breland
text:
Highly recommended! Nice, CLEAN, new facility with easy access anytime. Rates are competitive. Stacey goes above and beyond to help with anything you might need. When we were moving out, we thought we might have a few things left over that we would retrieve at a later date, and she offered to let us move them to a smaller unit and adjust the rent accordingly.  We ended up not needing to do that, but when we moved out our final month was prorated, which saved us quite a bit.

She also picked up some boxes for me from their other location and brought them to the Overton store, which saved me a few dollars and some time and miles compared to buying the same type of box at a hardware store.

I had an excellent experience overall; great people to work with!

name: Lily White
text: I love this place!! They have great service and are very nice. The facility is very neat and clean. Also, their coloring contest prizes are awesome! I can tell they try and put a lot of effort into everything they do. Thanks Coolbox for having great service and being awesome!

text: I highly recommend CoolBox's Liberty Park location.  Clean, multiple points of access, and well supplied with furniture moving equipment.  The climate control is superior, and the price is very reasonable.

text: Coolbox has been a God send for my business and the staff has quickly become friends. The facility is top notch and the location convenient. You can expect more than a traditional storage facility and the extra touches Coolbox provides; like water bottles, coffee and mints is a small sample of the Coolbox going above and beyond for their customers. I give five stars without reservation.

text: Wonderful experience!  I used this facility for temporary storage in between moves.  The facility is impeccably well kept and all staff are friendly and helpful.  They also offer an app to control gate access, which was super convenient!  They have great amenities including clean bathrooms, bottled water, coffee, and cookies (if you time them right!),  not to mention their holiday services.  I highly recommend this storage facility and will definitely use them again in the future for any storage needs I have.

text: After a problem with the folks who were supposed to buy our house, we were in a real predicament with what to do with all our belongings. Our moving company recommended the new Cool Box facility and contacted Michelle, the manager, for us. As promised, she made it as easy and painless as we could have asked for! So friendly, helpful, and accommodating for our odd situation, they were GREAT!! Turned out we needed them only for a week, but I would not hesitate to use them again. Loved the color-coded aisles and the high-tech gate and door access tools. Outstanding experience even in the middle of our crazy situation. Thank you, Cool Box!

name: Marcus Ferguson
text:
Borderline criminal behavior and unwilling to honor their promise. We were quoted a fair price for the storage unit. We were also told that if we presented proof of our homeowners insurance (which we did) that we would avoid paying their monthly warranty fee. Well, I was unable to pay my first bill online because their website wasn't cooperating. I called and had them email my account info to me again. Still didn't work. So I called and asked if I could pay over the phone without having to pay the customer service fee they usually assess for phone payments. The lady agreed, which was great, but guess what was also included on the bill...the warranty fee!  I really didn't notice until I received the invoice for the following month, and wouldn't you know it, there is that warranty fee again! So I called the iStorage location to get it cleared up. She removed the warranty fee from the upcoming bill, but refused to credit my account for the prior month's overpayment because I paid over the phone! The way I see it, that type of behavior is, at the very least, wildly unethical, and may even be criminal.

Edit/Update: I just received a call from a nice lady from iStorage.  She apologized for the error and credited my account.  I'm still dissatisfied with the individuals at the Central Parkway location for their actions, but I'm relieved that someone from iStorage (corporate, I'm guessing) had enough integrity to make things right.

resp.text: Hello, Mr. Ferguson, I hope we were able to resolve this issue to your satisfaction. We apologize for the mistake and genuinely look forward to serving you in the future, happy and satisfied customers are our number one priority. The iStorage Team.

name: Rebecca Moore
text: The price went up 4 - 5 times in the 2 years I rented a unit. Ridiculous.

resp.text: We value all our customers and work hard to keep our prices competitive and fair. Unfortunately, operating cost such as property taxes, insurance, maintenance, utilities, overhead, etc. are not stable and increase year over year.  For us to maintain excellent service levels we must pass along a portion of those increases to our customers.  In addition, unlike several of our competitors who raise rents every couple of months, we process increases annually.  We are continuing to make improvements throughout the facility including asphalt, paint and building repairs to ensure that your experience at iStorage is the best possible. We look forward to serving you in the future. If there is anything more we can do to improve your experience please email us at info@istorage.com or give us a call toll free at 844-311-2342. Best Regards, the iStorage Team.

name: Sarah Vanderford
text: I ended my lease with public storage and they continued to charge me for another month. I confirmed my lease was ended twice with a public storage employee and that I did not need to do anything else, I was payed up, and they proceeded to pass off my "bill" for another month to a debt collector. Lower management was initially helpful and confirmed that I did indeed vacate long before they said I did, and he was going to fix the issue, but then he saw it had gone to collections and there was nothing he could do with that. So he gave me the contact information for management out of Birmingham, and they never returned my calls. She answered once and the call dropped or something? And I could never get her to answer again. My fiance and I used their advertised discounts on our first two months, and ended the lease before the outrageous increase on rent the third month. We couldn't afford their regular rates. What I do know is that the company did yet again refuse to correct their mistake when I refuted the charge with the debt collector. My next step will be to pursue legal action if I can. Hopefully I do have enough proof that I did reach out and end my lease. They have hurt my credit and charged me for a space that I cancelled. Their discounts in the beginning are nice, but they will absolutely charge you for whatever they decide to. When you cancel your lease, they might simply just have "forgotten to write it down" and then refuse to fix it. I wish I could press charges. This is theft in every way.

name: Adam Sawyer
text:
Warning: Pricing will change!
This is not specific to the Leeman Ferry location.  But if you think you got a good deal on the price (online special), it will go away faster than you think.  I signed a contract for $69 per month.  Within 5 months, that price was increased to the standard price of $81 per month (a 17% increase).

I did receive a notice that stated 'In keeping with our high standards of location storage, it's occasionally necessary to make adjustments to our rates.'   However the advertised online pricing at the same time as my increase was even lower ($65 per month).

Public Storage makes sure you are fully moved into your storage unit, and then will take away any pricing deal!  They will not reduce the rate back to the original pricing.  You will have no choice but to pay the standard rate or move out.

name: Crow Bro
text: I had never rented a storage unit before, and had SO many questions, but Courtney was absolutely amazing! She helped me through every step of the process, and answered all of my questions with professionalism, courtesy, and absolutely wonderful customer service. I am not storing anything that would necessarily be of much value to many people, but it still gave me a great sense of security knowing that she is always on site looking out for my belongings and those of other tenants. She made me feel very confident not only in her abilities in her job, but also in the care and respect that she shows to tenants at Midgard. She was super friendly, a great conversationalist, and definitely set the bar for any future self-storage experiences I may have in the future. She is an absolute gem!

name: Chandler Bridges
text: Okay, let me start by saying I have moved many many times. I have also had storage units for over 25 years and in all sizes, shapes, and locations. This facility in little old Florence is by far the absolute best experience I have ever had. Not only with the storage units (clean, well lit, safe, 24 hour access), but also in that this location is a U-haul renter. I have rented 10 foot, 15 foot, and 26 foot trucks with ease multiple times from these nice folks in my two years here in Florence. Also, I have taken two 12 foot trailers and a 26 foot truck on one-way adventures. Every time the equipment is ready and the service is super fast. Alex the on-site manager is by far the nicest and most accommodating employee I have ever met at a place like this. It is always a pleasure to go in and see him. Leah, his competent co-worker, is equally as pleasant and adept at getting the job done for the customer with ease. I really can’t speak highly enough about the staff at this fantastic location. I hope if Alex ever leaves this job he would consider working for me, because I know and appreciate the value of an employee that not only cares about the customer’s business but also values the interactions with them as well. Well stocked, honest, considerate and caring sums up this Chisholm road location. They get my highest recommendation.

resp.text: Dear Most Valued Customer - the staff of Midgard Self Storage on Chisholm Road in Florence Alabama sincerely thank you for providing the highest rating for customer service, cleanliness, security and 24x7 access to your RV equipment.  We sincerely appreciate you as a customer and know you took valuable time to provide this highest review and very kind words.  They are most appreciated and we thank you and look forward to continuing to meet your self-storage needs.

text: I have been the Site Manager for 15 years. We have great rates and the largest selection of Standard, Climate Control, and RV/Boat Storage Units in the area. text: I have rented here for almost 2 years. I haven’t had any issues. No break ins. I have a climate controlled unit and I love it.

name: james moss
text: I have used Southtowne Mini-Warehouse for over 20 years.  I have never had a problem and appreciate the great staff!

name: Britton Morgan
text: Rudest manager ever!! Stopped by to ask about a climate controlled unit and I was treated as if I was intruding on his time. Nothing was available, which isn't a big deal, but don't give me an attitude and tell me to come back the next week. Guy never even stood up nor got off his computer. I also asked where could I find the climate controlled so I can see what kind of area they are in, was told "Lady, I have 3 separate properties I manage and they are all in a 10 mile radius." I told him yes I saw that on your website but there is no such road that is listed on it and we couldn't find it.  Was told "Yes they are pretty difficult to find." Will NEVER recommend them to anyone and they will NEVER get my business. We wanted a larger C.C. unit and to put our travel trailer here, not now. Not real smart to be rude to the people to are going to give you money and keep you in business.

resp.text:
Dear Britton,

We are terribly sorry to hear about the experience you had at our business. We have had the same manager for over 10 years and he recently retired. The replacement for him was the man that you dealt with and after only a few short months we terminated his employment. He was a completely different person in front of the ownership than he was in front of the customer. He was let go immediately.  We also apologize for the late response. The ownership of our business was claimed by someone else on google. It took 3 months to reclaim our business with google. We rely on customer satisfaction and we pride ourselves in each customer's experience with our business.  We immediately took action when we discovered that our reputation had been put in jeopardy. Once again, our sincerest apologies for the experience you had with our business.

name: Brian Ragsdale
text: Great place to store your things

name: Toria Moffett
text: DO NOT USE THIS PLACE. the new manager is crooked and we lost everything we put in our storage building. A washer and a dryer, a big wide screen tv, all of our baby's bedroom stuff, all of our memorabilia, everything we put in our storage unit was stolen. The new managers lock was put on our building and the employee that came to assist us said this happens every other week that the new manager has let it go to hell and is crooked. They let us pay each month not informing us of any break ins we went to move into our new residence and every thing was gone and the manager admitted in front of the cops that his lock was on our building but he didn't put it on. So either they have employees breaking in stealing things then putting the company's locks on the units or the owner is.

resp.text:
Dear Toria,

We are so sorry for the experience that you had with Southtowne. The manager that you are referring to has been terminated from his position at Southtowne. Thanks to reviews like yours we are able to monitor the customer experience with our business. We are so sorry for the troubles you experienced. For over 30 years we have done our best to make the customers experience exactly what they want and expect in mini storage. Thank you for your input and know that our customer reviews and satisfaction has been the driving force of our business for its entirety. Once again, we are terribly sorry for the trouble you experienced.

text: Fantastic experience with the Government St. StorageMax. As an active duty military member I have used many different storage facilities all over the country. text: This is a great facility! I only dealt with the management upon initial sign up and John is so friendly. He explained everything about the facility and answered all my questions before walking me to my unit. The access to the facility is so convenient, this is why I never really saw John again. The access code entry after business hours was very helpful to my schedule. The facility is clean, air conditioned, easy to navigate, and there's a water cooler. I know it seems small but cold water after moving furniture is necessary! The entrance is covered so I was able to move things in the rain. Online, recurring payments was also convenient so I knew my items were safe and going to be there when I returned. If you need storage, this is the place to go! I left this facility simply because I moved.

Uncle Bob's also offers the use of a truck to help bring your belongings to the facility.  What a GREAT service!!!  Security seems very adequate with CC cameras, a locked gate, and of course, locks on your unit.  We're very pleased with our decision.

name: Ranesha Carmichael
text: I just started renting a storage unit from this location at the beginning of August. On Friday Aug. 7 I was moving somethings into my unit when I locked  myself out of my car. The property manger Lisa allowed me to use the phone in the office to call my insurance company for roadside assistance. Lisa also gave me a cold bottle of water and a place to sit in the office while I waited for pop a lock. To some this may not seem like much but in the middle of a long summer day when the weather was 95 degrees or better this was everything to me. I was already frustrated and tired and the lock out was pushing me to my limits. Her simple act of kindness and conversation while I waited made my day better. I would highly recommend this place to anyone because their customer service is beyond excellent and some many businesses are missing that today.

resp.text: Thank you so much for choosing to store with us and the wonderful review. We try very hard to have the best customer service around it. We hope to see you again in the future!

name: Janet Conte
text: The online process was a little confusing, however when I went to the local office it became worse. The woman at the desk was not interested in assisting me. She acted like i should know where to go and how to get there, when I was a new customer. I found my 10X30 unit (with the assist. of 2 gentlemen who were there working in their unit), which was inside a hallway when it was advertised as outside entrance. The unit has 3 doors. One with a lock on it /no key, one door that functions, and one door my husband will need a crowbar to push up to meet the  latch so we can lock it. We will not be able to open 2 of the 3 doors.  Inside there are 3 lights of which NONE work. Again my husband will need to change out the bulbs so we may see.   The hall the unit is off of is very narrow and I'm concerned it may be difficult to move some things in and out. I would change Storage companies but it is very difficult to get the deposit back, if at all.  The online reviews were deceiving as well as the pictures used. If you are looking for storage in Mobile, look  elsewhere. Hopefully we want be there long.

name: Life with Jess
text: I had a horrible experience with this company and will be requesting my money in results of my experience. As I walked in the office to purchase a unit, There was another Tenant walking in complaining about someone breaking into her unit, and I should of left then however, I proceeded with the purchase. I purchased this unit on a Saturday expecting to have access on Sunday. When I arrived to the location, The gate code I received was incorrect, therefore leaving me with no other choice but to call customer service to get the correct information. As I spoke to the representative, She offered no apology after I explained to her what happened. She proceeds to give me the correct information. As I go back again, when I arrive to the unit, Another tenants belongs were blocking the doorway for me to get inside of my unit leaving me no choice but to rent the uhaul I purchased for extended hours because their office was closed until Monday. I was extremely flustered, Irritated and flabbergasted at the unkept unit and experience. I will NEVER use this place again or recommend anyone to use them.

resp.text: We appreciate you sharing your experience with this facility and providing feedback to us. As you mentioned, this location is no longer managed by Cubesmart. We purchased the property in April 2016, and we notified all of the existing customers in writing of that change. We have completed the transition of the brand and the online processes. One of our operating principles is to honor our customers in a transparent manner, and we strive to create the best storage experience for our new and existing customers. We would be happy to speak to you regarding your experience to ensure we are meeting those principles and your expectations. We can also explain or show you the steps for online bill pay and we can update any account information which may have changed. Please email us at info@moveitstorage.com or call 214-389-3939 to speak to our regional manager.

Not only have they failed on day 1 where they waited months to inform everyone that they are no longer Cubesmart and cant pay their bill online with out the new site info.
Cubesmart has been alerted to how horrible this company is running this place and how they are somewhat still trying to operate under the Cubesmart name. And even that this company is using two addresses for the same location.

Review on the units, well you can easily climb over the walls to other units if you wanted, there are spiders everywhere! It stinks, its just a horrible place. Don't store your valuables there if you really care about your belongings.

We have completed the transition of the brand and the online processes and we have also completed significant physical renovations to improve the property. Check in quick, guided and pointed out my spot and was able to come back that night and park it.
The Story behind my review if you wish to read on......  Reserved a spot online for a 38 Ft RV over the weekend.  They called to confirm on Monday and I booked it and moved in about 10 days later when I completed the purchase of RV.  Got the RV there during closed hours and it would not quite fit length because of ladder and mirrors so I left the door open and reserved a larger spot online that night.  They called me by lunch to confirm and see what they could do to get me moved.  We adjusted account over the phone and I moved it that night.  Locked up tight, with a little electricity to keep it charged.  Thanks!!

name: Jason Statum
text:
Rude & Unprofessional Staff...Choose Another Storage Facility

I can honestly say that I have never received such ill treatment at a place of business. The employees who manage Hampton Cove Self Storage were rude to my wife and I on multiple occasions.  The managers, apparently a husband and wife team, cannot answer simple questions about the availability of additional storage units.  Both have a terrible attitude toward their job and direct it toward the paying customers of this establishment.

Be prepared for yelling, rude remarks, and aggressive behavior from the husband if you should have legitimate questions about you bill.  When my wife and I questioned a late charge on our bill, he began to scream at us and he told us to get out.  My wife and I cleared out our unit immediately.  We will never set foot on the premises again after receiving such ill treatment.

I contacted one of the owners and left a message asking to speak with her about my negative experience with Hampton Cove Self Storage.   Hopefully, she will return my call so that I can voice my concerns to her directly.  There are four owners of this establishment and they need to know how their employees are ruining their business as well as their reputations in the community.

If you are looking to rent a storage unit, I strongly suggest that you take your business to another establishment where you will be treated with common courtesy and respect.

Would’ve taken all of two minutes to walk out and see if they could do it for me but I guess that’s their idea of customer service.

resp.text: Hi! We apologize that you had this issue. We do have restrictions on certain weights of  propane tanks that we can fill. We would like to turn your experience around, so please reach out to info@storageasset.com with more details of your experience.

Would not give me a written eviction notice or tell me owner's name.  After I left the property the manager called me back saying he had spoken with the owner and that it was OK to store my belongings in my unit after all.  Unbelievable.  Left owner a message and still have not heard back.

name: Sharon Morrison
text: I originally  gave this business  a 1 star review. My intent was to make the owner  understand the hardship he caused with what he called an honest  mistake. When I attempted  to access  my unit at 6:00 am the gate would not open. After multiple  attempts  and a messages  left on the answering machine I left. I returned  at 7:30 am hoping  that maybe the system was down and it had been corrected.  Unfortunately,  that was not the case. I once again left a message.  I waited until  8:00 am and called a 3rd time which he finally  answered. He had given us the the wrong code. The honest mistake caused a delay of 4 hours and additional expenses. I am disappointed  that the owner never apologized for his actions. I will say that the storage facility met our needs at the time and for that we are grateful.

resp.text: According to our phone records you called us around 7:00am Sunday morning and again at around 7:30.  The call was returned immediately at 8:32 when I received the message.  I am very sorry that you were inconvenienced by my honest mistake, but we are a small family owned business and do not have a call center.   I apologized at the time of my return call and then again when we spoke the next time.  I am human and am subject to making mistakes but will always try to do my best to rectify them.   Again, I'm very sorry that you were inconvenienced but it was an hour and a half, not 4 hours, and I've now apologized 3 separate times.   We are sorry for your experience and wish you the best moving forward.

name: Brandy Lockey
text: Having 24 hour access would be great especially for those who are not in the area all the time like myself. With our work schedules it's hard to make it there during your hours a lot of the times

resp.text: Thank you for the review.   We made the decision to limit access hours for safety purposes.  We aim to provide a safe secure environment for our tenants and their belongings.  It is for that reason that we limit access hours from 6am to 9pm.  We understand that can be an inconvenience for some people that would be coming in for the right reasons.  However, not everyone has good intentions late at night.   Unfortunately, the actions of a few have a negative impact for everyone else.   Sorry for any inconvenience.  Thank you again for the feedback.

Anyway, I liked the location and the unit was clean.  But the hours the unit was accessible to me were limited and often resulted in my having to wait until the next day to access my storage. All in all, my experience with this bunch was not good.  I won't be back.

name: Audrey M. Sprinkle
text: This place is a JOKE! We have been with this storage place for a little over 2 years. And have been locked out 3 times, even though our payment was current. And surprise, surprise it was a Sunday and they are closed. So we couldn't access our storage unit. The first time, the office decided we needed to change or pin bc the code they gave us was to easy to access the unit for others. Which I completely understand, but they didn't even call us, just locked us out. The second time, the new owners had taken over and decided we needed to update or CC agreement (we needed to sign it) so we got locked out again.. the third and final time they locked us out bc the cc was expired. I WENT IN AND SIGNED A NEW CC FORM IN JANUARY, THEY CHARGED US IN FEBRUARY AND THEN LOCKED US OUT ON MARCH. MAKES NO SENSE!!! My husband had taken off the day to have all of our stuff from our shed at home  moved to this storage shed.  And he couldn't bc they had locked us out. And I would also like to add. The March payment was due on the 1st.. so even if they didn't have an updated card on file, which they did, I still had the entire day to pay it. So i called the office this am to see what happened and the lady in the office says "oh the card was expired." I told her I had came in and filled one out in January, and was charged February so there's no way that's possible. She then says I'm not sure why that didn't work. Really. So me being inconvenienced and my husband missing an entire work day is ok. Whatever. We are finding somewhere better that will actually allow us to access or stuff when we need to! Do not store your items here!!!!

I'm not sure where you rented your truck from, but on your next truck rental please give us an opportunity to show you how we take care of our customers. text: We sent one of our employees to pick up a cargo Van, there was a delay in out Florida U-Haul when making transactions for the other drivers in Florida, so it stopped the rental in AL at this location temporarily, nevertheless, the general general manager at this location told our employee to not waste her TIME WITH US......she wrongfully advised our employee to dismiss us, I have never had this experience with U-Haul. It took 20 minutes to resolve but she still had given that advise. Ridiculous!

name: Anthony Bunger
text:
Tl;dr I moved from Glen Iris to Hueytown in a few hours and paid $150 for a 15’ truck.Conflicting information from representatives, stressful environment, overpriced. Moving is already stressful, and having to deal with people who want to make things harder is a no-go. I don’t plan on using uhaul again after my experience at this location.

Rented a truck from here on Saturday morning that was due back Sunday at a different location in ensley.

The woman working Saturday morning was helpful, and suggested returning the truck back at the same location because it might be cheaper for us, depending on the mileage and our specific situation.

We were done with the truck early, brought it back that night around 5 to a different uhaul rep (a man). While he was helping us, a different woman uhaul rep told us that we couldn’t return our truck to a different location than on our sheet because it would be more expensive, while the man smirked. Obviously I was confused. I was unable to contact the location that I was supposed to return the truck to (in ensley). When i told her the woman from the morning told us it would be cheaper and insisted she said “okay, charge him! Charge him!” I waited for a long time for her to direct the man in how to check my truck in, And eventually she went out to the vehicle and came back to show me $1,075 charge that would be applied If I returned the vehicle here. So After an hour and a half of run-around, intimidation, and waiting, I left to the place in ensley and returned my truck there, where no one was working (it was 6:20 pm) and left the keys in a box.

name: Lilly Putar
text: Whatever you do, do not hire top of the line moving and labor services to help you move. They do their business/evil through U-Haul and will damage your stuff when they move it. They will then follow that up by coming back to your property to destroy stuff. In my case, they broke into my car. Uhaul trucks are also terrible and mine overheated and killed my cat. I think its fair to say I hate U Haul.

name: adam lawley
text:
Amor Safe is wonderful!!! I’ve just started using them for our storage needs, and am very pleased with the service options, staffing assistance, and resources that they provide.
Everything is very clean! Everything is very secure. I rest easily knowing the belongings that I invested in will be taken care of by the team at Armor Safe.
The staff is extremely helpful as well!

name: B A Buckland
text: Friendly, helpful employees. Clean facility.

name: Evan Harden
text: This storage facility goes above and beyond any other facility I've ever seen or rented from myself. It is the cleanest, friendliest, and most secure facility you could imagine. The owner goes above and beyond to serve his customers and keep his facility in tip top shape. The storage facility has been open for 14 years but looks like it just opened yesterday. You are never out of sight of a camera. There's plenty of bright lighting to help you see inside your unit and all around the facility. They also sell all kinds of packing and moving supplies which is very convenient so you don't have to go down the mountain to get what you need. I've been storing here since they opened and have been very pleased for 14 years. ArmorSafe Storage is very unique in the fact that they offer the greatest most personable experience for their customers in a very impersonal world. Highly recommend them to store the things you want to keep safe.

name: Theresa LoRusso
text: Super clean, temperature controlled, safe storage facility with easy access and free use of dolly's for loading and unloading.

name: Dedric Griffin
text: I like this storage area! Clean, climate controlled and the technological amenities the units offer are top notch. If you have to move and the weather isn't good at least you know that you can stay dry and safe using these storage units. And they have different sizes to select from so you have options. For the price they are very well worth it!

Customer service always has been an attitude with me.Try to pay my bills online this last month just like have always done in the past and it wouldnt let pay. So I call TK to inform her of the website not working and she care inform me that there is a service fee for them to take my credit card payment over the phone. They made me pay 2 service fees since I had 2 different units since I couldn't pay my bill online because there website not working. Why should I have to pay service fee for there screw up website. She tells me is there nothing I can do about it which is BS. I have try to call corporate number and no one has call me back. Like I said, the biggest problem I have with Halls Mill location is her attitude she gives off to me.

Also, the other day I walk thru one of the climate control units to get to my unit and the inside smelled like urine. It time for me to start looking for another place that actually treat me like a customer.

name: John Sullivan
text:
Have a storage unit there that Mother N law and i have had for approximately ten years.  My husbands belongings from his divorce are in it and my mother in law has been paying it.  She is 83 years old and has had a stroke.  I have been paying her bills since August.  The guy there knows that i pay the bill.  I've never been called for a late bill and as I live in her house now to provide her care, i would know if she had been called. It's never been late.   Now they are calling and harrassing her for money because a LATE fee will be added on TOMORROW.  I tried to call Yesterday and NO ONE would answer.  I've paid it on the 5th of EVERY month since I've been paying the bills and I get a woman....(always been a very nice man in the past) who is a witch and says she is the manager.  I became angry with her and asked her what I needed to do to close agreement out as I was going to come get my things out of the unit.  She said my mother in law would have to come there to do it.  She KNOWS my mother in law is bed ridden and can't handle the account.  I even got my mother in olaw to tell her she could discuss the account with me...........she insists that SHE has to come by to sign off on the contract.  She advised my mother in law that she set her up on AUTO PAY.  I promise you I will have a new Debit card and I dare her to try to charge anything on this account.  They won't get one more dime out of me!!!

Since I can't respond to the response I received on this.....I will say that My husband IS ON THE LEASE.  It is HIS belongings.  My mother in law just use to pay it.  And "Witch" was a nice way of saying so much more.......... She was awful and lost long term customers...not to mention, i discourage anyone from using this location.

resp.text: Hi John, My name is Evan. I am not a manager but I am part of the support staff at iStorage. I think there is some misunderstanding because we cannot give out customer information to someone who isn't on the lease...and you can't cancel a lease if you aren't on it. If you can have Wanda add her daughter-in-law to the lease, then she can have control of the account. Since Wanda can't come down to the facility, she has the ability to add her daughter-in-law to the lease over the phone. If you have any other questions please give me a call at 805-570-5528. Also, please do not call our manager a "witch" - we can get everything resolved without the name calling.

name: Dennis Hamlet
text: Great location and quality facilities

name: Robert Johnson
text:
Extremely disappointed in customer service.  There are several issues.

We were recently charged a late fee of $10.  Not really a big deal. There are some HUGE issues with this and what they are trying to do.  Got paid on 10/31 & paid my bills through Wells Fargo bill pay.  Payment went out on 11/1.  Iron Guard called to say that it was a day late & that we owed $10 even though they had the $150 payment in hand. Again not really a big deal.  BUT, they said they will not process the $150 that we paid until we paid the $10 late fee.  The reason for this is that they can then charge us another $40 late fee if we don't pay the $10 in a week.

A ton of issues with this. How can they not process the $150? If we owe $10 for it being a day late, fine. But they will literally charge us $40 on the extra $10 we owe while giving us one week to settle that! That is flat out extortion & I have no idea how that is legal.  Also, how could a $150 payment incur a $50 (10+40) late fee after two week anyways?

Next, they called us to tell us that our $150 was late by a day.

Again, not really worried up the $10, but ...
How do we know that it was actually late?  How do we know that they didn't get the payment on time & they just said they didn't? Or they got it and someone didn't open until the next day or the person that opens bills wasn't out that day?  And we paid it on time like we always do (Oct. 31), it got messed up somewhere in processing (WF, post office, Iron Guard).

But now, over that $10, that we are not even disputing, they are holding us hostage to get another $40.  What happens if we miss that deadline? Is the next payment $400? Ha.

After a couple of months, our rate went up $40 a month.  We were not aware of that.  I am sure it was in the fine print, but really?

Next issue, they FORCE you to buy insurance with their insurance company for $10 a month.  Again, was not aware of that until I got the first bill.  I have had other storage units in the state of Alabama and never had to do that.  That sounds pretty unethical.  I would bet that an attorney could do some digging and find a kickback or an unethical business relationship there. I have no proof, but it sure sounds fishy.  And I can insure an entire house worth of goods with renters insurance for around $10 a month with a reputable insurance company.

Lastly, let me contrast my experience with another company just this week - Point Broadband.  My payment was rejected.  My debit card was damaged and I was issued a new card.I forgot to alert Point about the card change.  They sent an email and I got the it resolved with ZERO issues.  This was my fault.  I should have been subjected to a higher rate because I get a discounted rate due to auto withdrawal. But nope, good ole' customer service, something Iron Guard does not currently have.

Again, I paid my bill. For some reason it took longer than usual to process it.  They can't really prove they didn't have it on time. But I have ZERO issue with paying that late $10 fee. It is what it is. But, they are going to threaten us with another $40? What the heck?? We have paid on time every single month and now are a day late and are going to treat us like that.  And I don't think it is legal what they are doing by refusing to process my $150 I paid so they can then charge us more.  And don't forget the rate increase and mandatory insurance.

They will be losing our business ASAP & our $150 a month. And heads up Iron Guard, you have empty units now, so it isn't like you are replacing that $150.  All over not just either waving that $10 (would be nice & good customer service- but we weren't even asking that), or just adding the $10 to our next bill and moving on. Hope that hunger for that extra $40 was worth the literal $18,000 you will lose over the next 10 years.

Update: We are out! Got another place nearby. Cheaper and climate controlled and found out that our homeowner’s insurance covers our stuff anyways, so Ironguard was stealing $10 from us every month.

resp.text: Hi Robert, thank you, for, leaving us a review.  A member of our customer support team will reach out to you shortly to address your concerns

name: Richard Stewart
text: BE INFORMED!!!!  I rented a unit app. 2 months ago (mid- April) based on the online monthly rental promotion ($139/ month).  I was forced to pay an additional $10 per month at time of signing for a "protection plan rate".  Today, I was informed my monthly rental charge would be increasing (beginning August 1st) by almost 25%.  In short, the promotional, advertised rate of $139 (increased immediately upon signing to $149) is increasing to a total of $185 per month.  I spoke with the manager and she said management dictated price increases, etc. and she couldn't do anything about the increase.  Nice storage units with friendly staff.....but, their marketing scheme is very deceitful in that once you've gone to the effort to move your storage items in, they increase the rate (25%), forcing you to pay the upcharge, or expend the effort to move elsewhere.  BTW, there are numerous other storage locations who charge flat rates (monthly/ annually) for significantly less.

resp.text: Hi Richard, Thanks for your business and sorry to read about your frustration. I spoke with one of our team members and I was advised that your concern has been resolved. Please don't hesitate stop by our office if you have any other questions.

text: I was pleasantly surprised when I found this storage company. Iron guard storage is great!. They are reasonably priced and very professional. name: NC Franklin
text:
If you are looking for long-term storage, I would not recommend this place.  The rates are constantly increased every other month after you get in.  You can expect rate increases every other month! ...and WITHOUT THE LEGALLY REQUIRED  30-DAY
WRITTEN, ADVANCE NOTICE.
And since for most people, moving out would be such an unexpected inconvenience, work and expense, you end up being stuck there paying the hiked up rate.  It's like the old "bait and switch" routine.  They lure you in with a low rate then hike it up after you are there! Plus pot holes and burned out lights are not repaired or replaced. Then if you get injured because of their negligence, they don't want to be held liable... but they are. BE INFORMED...BEWARE! If you have doubts, ask BEFORE moving in, when your rates will increase, because they WILL.

resp.text: Thanks for reaching out, NC Franklin. Per our lease agreement, rental rates are subject to change. Market rates are constantly fluctuating, which determines when rate increases happen. It appears that someone from our office have reviewed your account and discussed your new rent rate.

You have  24/7 access to your storage unit in the Annex. Their no hassle, no hidden cost. The  price you are quoted is the price you pay. Compared to other company iStorage offer the best deals in town.

My storage unit was broken into 10/8/2024
Manager, Michael Williams,   immediately took charge and called the police and also informed me and I came and determined what had been taken and the process was very smooth and done in a professional manner.   IStorage fixed my lock on my unit in a timely manner and I greatly appreciated.

name: B Mitch
text: This is the absolute worst managed company I've ever dealt with! They've changed names twice and provided no notice beforehand. Originally Uncle Bob's, then Istorage, now Ironguard. When you go to make an online payment, the website is no longer there and you are left scrambling at the last minute with either making a fee based payment over the phone or driving to the actual facility. Once I'm moved out of their facility, I will never do business with them again! NEVER! Be careful with company's that continuously change names.
